text:
12(a) Bibliographical Sketch

 

Gary E.Lyons, Ph.D. —ASSt. Professor Principal. Investigator
Educatior

Yale University, New Haven, CT B.S. 1979 Biology
univ. of Pennsylvania

Medical School Philadelphia, PA Ph.D. 1986 Anatomy
Positi :

1987-1988 Postdoctoral Fellow, Dept. of Medicine, stanford Univ.

1989-1991 Postdoctoral Fellow, Dept. of Molecular Biology
Pasteur Institute, Paris, France

Ig91-present Asst. Professor of Anatomy, Univ. of Wisconsin
Medical School

Honors:

1990-1991 Fogarty International Center, NIH-French CNRS
Postdoctoral Fellowship Award

 

Publications: (most significant papers indicated by an asterisk)

1. Lyons, G.E., Haselgrove, J., Kelly, A.M. and Rubinstein, N.
(1983) Myosin ‘transitions in developing fast and slow muscles of the
rat hindlimb. Differentiation 25: 168-175.

2. Gambke, B., Lyons, G.E., Haselgrove, J., Kelly, A.M. and
Rubinstein, N.A. (1983) Thyroidal and neural control of myosin
transitions during development of rat fast and slow muscles. FEBS
Lett. 156: 335-340.

3. Lyons, G-E., Kelly, A.M. and Rubinstein, N.A. (1986)

‘Testosterone-induced Changes in contractile protein isoforms of the
sexually-dimorphic temporalis muscle of the guinea pig. J. Biol.
Chem. 261: 13278-13284.
* "4. Sassoon, D., Lyons, G., Wright, W., Lin, V., Lassar, A.,
Weintraub, H. and Buckingham, M. (1989) Expression of two myogenic
regulatory factors: myogenin and MyoD1 during mouse embryogenesis.
Nature 341: 303-307.

5. Ito, H., Miller, S.C., Billingham, M.E., Akimoto, H., Torti,
sS., Wade, R., Gahlmann, R., Lyons, G., Kedes, L. and Torti, F.(1990)
Doxorubicin selectively inhibits muscle gene expression in
cardiocytes in vivo and in vitro. Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 87:
4275-4279.

* 6. Lyons, G.E., Ontell, M., Cox, R., Sassoon, D. and Buckingham,
M. (1990) Thé expression of myosin genes in developing skeletal
miscle in the mouse embryo. J. Cell Biol. 111: 1465-1476.

* 7. Lyons, G.E., Schiaffino, S., Barton, P., Sassoon, D., and
Buckingham, M. (1990) Developmental regulation of myosin gene
expression in mouse cardiac mscle. J. Cell Biol. 111: 2427-2436.

8. Lyons, G.E., Buckingham, M., Tweedie, S., and Edwards, Y.

(1991) Carbonic anhydrase III, an’early mescdermal marker, is
expressed in embryonic mouse skeletal muscle and notochord.
Development 111: 233-244.
* 9. Ott, M-O., Bober, E., Lyons, G., Arnold, H. and Buckingham,
M. (1991) Early expression of the myogenic regulatory gene, myf-5, in
precursor cells of skeletal muscle in the mouse embryo. Development
ills 1097-1107.

10. Lyons, G.E., Buckingham, M.E. and Mannherz, H.G. (1991) o-
actin proteins and gene transcripts are colocalized in embryonic
mouse muscle. Development 111: 451-454.

summary: Gary E. Lyons, Ph.D. is a Professor of Anatomy at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. He is the author of a number of books on the subject of muscle development. His work has been published in the Journal of the American College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists (JACOG)
